uniques.name: Epic of Battle
uniques.value: +5% Science when the empire is happy. +3 Culture, +1 Happiness and +1 Production from conquered cities. Generals give a +15% combat strength against cities to nearby units.

uniques.name: Akkadian Library
uniques.value: Replaces Library: Costs no maintenance, +1 science.

uniques.name: Laputtu
uniques.value: Replaces Spearmen. 13 strength. Increased tile improvement rates on tiles where it is stationed (+100%).

uniques.name: Manifest Destiny
uniques.value: All land military units have +1 Sight. 50% discount when purchasing tiles.

uniques.name: Minutemen
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the American civilization. Replaces the Musketmen.

uniques.name: Pioneer
uniques.value: Replaces Settler. Ignores Terrain cost. 5 combat strength

uniques.name: Ships of the Desert
uniques.value: Caravans gain 50% extended range. Your trade routes spread the home city's religion twice as effectively. Oil resources are doubled.

uniques.name: Camel Archer
uniques.value: Unique ranged mounted unit of the Arabian civilization. Replaces the Knight. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Bazaar
uniques.value: Unique building of the Arabian civilization. Replaces the Market.

uniques.name: Pride of the People
uniques.value: +1 Food from Pastures, build pastures twice as fast

uniques.name: Gaucho
uniques.value: Replaces Riflemen. 4 Movement, 34 strength, considered a mounted unit. May withdraw from Melee attacks (50% chance). May build Pastures and Farms faster than a regular worker

uniques.name: Tanguería
uniques.value: Replaces Opera House. +3 culture. Has 1 slot for musicians.

uniques.name: Splendor of the Caucasus
uniques.value: +1 Food, +2 Production and +1 Gold from Mountains (including Mountain natural wonders - i.e. Kilimanjaro, Uluru, Mt. Fuji, Mt. Sinai, Mt. Kailash, Rock of Gibraltar and Sri Pada)

uniques.name: Sparapet
uniques.value: Replaces Horseman. Requires 80 production and 2 horses, 17 combat strength, has Great General +15% combat to surrounding units (2 radius). Does not obsolete

uniques.name: Darbas
uniques.value: Replaces observatory. Provides +1 culture, +4 science base and +3 culture and +4 science on mountains. (this includes mountain natural wonders)

uniques.name: Siege Warfare
uniques.value: +1 movement for all siege units. Free Great Writer at Philosophy

uniques.name: Royal Library
uniques.value: +1 culture, +1 science

uniques.name: Siege Tower
uniques.value: Unique siege unit of the Assyrian civilization. Replaces the Catapult.

uniques.name: Dreamtime
uniques.value: +5 Faith from Natural Wonders.

uniques.name: Ngangkari
uniques.value: Replaces Worker. Starts with Medic I and Medic II promotions. Has +1 movement, can build workboats (4 turn build). Will not consume the unit

uniques.name: Convict Penitentiary
uniques.value: Replaces Constabulary. Available at Machinery. Provides +1 gold, +1 production, +5% gold, and +5% production

uniques.name: Diplomatic Marriage
uniques.value: Can spend Gold to annex or puppet a City-State that has been your ally for 5 turns.

uniques.name: Hussar
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Austrian civilization. Replaces the Cavalry. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Coffee House
uniques.value: Unique building of the Austrian civilization. Replaces the Windmill.

uniques.name: Justice of Saladin
uniques.value: All cities receive a free Burial Tomb upon capture. +25% Improvement construction rate.

uniques.name: Madrasah
uniques.value: Replaces University. +2 Faith, +1 Science from Flood Plains, +2 Science from Oases.

uniques.name: Mamluk
uniques.value: Replaces Knight. 20 Strength, +50% vs Melee units, +25% vs Gunpowder units.

uniques.name: Sacrificial Captives
uniques.value: Gains Culture for the empire from each enemy unit killed.

uniques.name: Floating Gardens
uniques.value: Unique building of the Aztec civilization. Replaces the Water Mill. +10% Food, +1 Food for each worked lake tile, +2 food and +1 Production, City must border fresh water

uniques.name: Jaguar
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the Aztec civilization. Replaces the Warrior. Available right from the start of the game.

uniques.name: Ingenuity
uniques.value: Receive a free Great Scientist when you discover Philosophy. Earn Great Scientists 33% faster.

uniques.name: Walls of Babylon
uniques.value: Unique building of the Babylonian civilization. Replaces the Walls.

uniques.name: Bowman
uniques.value: Unique ranged unit of the Babylonian civilization. Replaces the Archer.

uniques.name: Colonialist Riches
uniques.value: +1 Production from Plantations. +1 Gold from Strategic Resources.

uniques.name: Stade
uniques.value: Replaces Zoo. +3 Happiness, +1 Culture, +1 Gold. Cheaper to construct.

uniques.name: Force Publique
uniques.value: Replaces Great War Infantry. 51 strength, has Drill I and Charge.

uniques.name: The Great Trek
uniques.value: +1 food from non-fresh water farms, +1 culture from farms after the discovery of Fertilizer

uniques.name: Staatsmuseum
uniques.value: Replaces Opera House. +3 Culture, has a Great Artist Specialist.

uniques.name: Voortrekker
uniques.value: Replaces Great War Infantry. Cheaper to build.50 Strength, +25% strength defending, heals completely upon killing a unit. Can build 2 turn Farms.

uniques.name: Carnival
uniques.value: Tourism output is +100% during their Golden Ages. Earn Great Artists, Musicians, and Writers 100% faster during their Golden Ages.

uniques.name: Pracinha
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Brazilian civilization. Replaces the Infantry. 80 Strength and Foreign Lands bonus (+20% Combat Strength in foreign territory) on top of its normal promotions.

uniques.name: Brazilwood Camp
uniques.value: Now available at Bronze Working (instead of Machinery). Provides +1 Production (instead of +2 Gold). Gains +2 Gold at Machinery and +2 Culture at Acoustics.

uniques.name: Cyrillic Script
uniques.value: Writer Specialists yield +3 science, Science buildings receive +1 culture

uniques.name: Konnitsa
uniques.value: Replaces knight, performs a ranged attack before attacking, has +25% combat bonus against gunpowder units.

uniques.name: Khambar
uniques.value: Replaces granary, 10% cheaper, in addition provides +1 gold from wheat and cow

uniques.name: Austronesian Thalassocracy
uniques.value: +1 Gold from water tiles.

uniques.name: Nelayan
uniques.value: Replaces Work Boat. Has 10 Combat Strength. Can build Fishing Boats and Kampong Ayer in 4 Turns.

uniques.name: Kampong Ayer
uniques.value: Requires Optics. Can be built on any coastal tile touching land. Provides +1 Food, +1 Culture and +1 Gold and an additional Culture and Gold after discovering Flight

uniques.name: Yainkyaayymhu Aamwayaanhait
uniques.value: +1 Happiness per city

uniques.name: Akyat Cannon
uniques.value: Replaces Cannon, available at Gunpowder. Has the same stats (that includes cost) as a Trebuchet but 3 range.

uniques.name: Kyawwat
uniques.value: Replaces Stoneworks, provides +1 happiness and +1 production. +1 production from salt, marble, stone, iron. Does not require any resource to build.

uniques.name: Patriarchate of Constantinople
uniques.value: Choose one more Belief than normal when you found a Religion.

uniques.name: Hippodrome
uniques.value: Replaces Amphitheater. Provides +2 faith, +2 culture, +1 happiness.

uniques.name: Cataphract
uniques.value: Unique mounted unit of the Byzantine civilization. Replaces the Horseman. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Canadian Fur Trade
uniques.value: +2 Gold from Camps, +2 Gold and +1 Culture from Lakes.

uniques.name: Combat Engineer
uniques.value: Replaces Rifleman. Available at Industrialization. 34 Strength, 3 Moves, can construct Roads, Railroads, Forts, and clear Forest, Jungle and Marsh.

uniques.name: Tim Horton’s
uniques.value: Replaces Stock Exchange. +2 Happiness. +1 gold on river tiles

uniques.name: Phoenecian Heritage
uniques.value: All coastal Cities get a free Harbor. Units may cross mountains after the first Great General is earned, taking 50 HP damage if they end a turn on a mountain.

uniques.name: Cothon
uniques.value: Replaces Lighthouse. +1 food, production and gold in addition to normal effects of a lighthouse

uniques.name: African Forest Elephant
uniques.value: No longer has increased production cost. If attacking from higher elevation (hills to flat land, mountain to non-mountain), gains +20% Combat Strength and knocks enemies back (Heavy Charge)

uniques.name: Druidic Lore
uniques.value: +1 Faith per city with an adjacent unimproved Forest. Bonus increases to +2 Faith in Cities with 3 or more adjacent unimproved Forest tiles.

uniques.name: Ceilidh Hall
uniques.value: Unique building of the Celtic civilization. Requires Amphitheater. Replaces Opera House. (+3 Culture)

uniques.name: Pictish Warrior
uniques.value: +50% vs Mounted/Mounted ranged units, 100% faith from kills.

uniques.name: Art of War
uniques.value: The Great General combat bonus is increased by 15%, and their spawn rate is increased by 50%.

uniques.name: Chu-Ko-Nu
uniques.value: A Chinese unique ranged unit. Replaces the Crossbowman.

uniques.name: Paper Maker
uniques.value: Unique building of the Chinese civilization. Replaces the Library.

uniques.name: Viking Fury
uniques.value: Also gives +1 production on fish tiles.

uniques.name: Berserker
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Danish civilization. Replaces the Longswordsman. Requires Iron.

uniques.name: Longship
uniques.value: Replaces Trireme. +2 movement, transfers movement to embarked units on the same tile

uniques.name: Monument Builders
uniques.value: +15% Production when building Wonders

uniques.name: Burial Tomb
uniques.value: Egyptian unique ranged mounted unit. Replaces the Chariot Archer.

uniques.name: War Chariot
uniques.value: Unique building of the Egyptian civilization. Requires Shrine. Replaces the Temple.

uniques.name: Sun Never Sets
uniques.value: +2 Movement for all naval units. Receives 1 extra Spy.

uniques.name: Longbowman
uniques.value: Unique ranged unit of the English civilization. Replaces the Crossbowman.

uniques.name: Ship of the Line
uniques.value: Unique ranged naval unit of the English civilization. Replaces the Frigate. Requires Iron. 30 Ranged Combat (from 35), 25 Melee (from 30)

uniques.name: Spirit of Adwa
uniques.value: Combat bonus (+20%) when fighting units from a Civilization with more Cities than Ethiopia.

uniques.name: Stele
uniques.value: Unique building of the Ethiopian civilization. Replaces the Monument. Available right from the start of the game.

uniques.name: Mehal Sefari
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Ethiopian civilization. Replaces the Rifleman.

uniques.name: Finnish Mobility
uniques.value: All Melee and Mounted Units have a 50% increased flanking bonus. +1 Culture from unimproved forest tiles.

uniques.name: Sissi
uniques.value: Replaces Machine Gun. 3 movement, ignores terrain cost, 50% bonus against armored.

uniques.name: Sauna
uniques.value: Replaces Shrine: +2 culture from Lakes, no maintenance, units trained in cities with a Sauna heal +10 health in friendly lands.

uniques.name: City of Light
uniques.value: +1 Culture in the Capital. +15 additional Culture in the Capital after the discovery of Acoustics. Theming bonuses in capital doubled.

uniques.name: Chateau
uniques.value: Cannot be built on a resource tile. Receives +2 Science and +1 Science at the Free Thought policy in addition to its regular yields.

uniques.name: Musketeer
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the French civilization. Replaces the Musketman.

uniques.name: Holy Roman Empire
uniques.value: +1 Faith from Farms.

uniques.name: Mead Hall
uniques.value: Replaces Colosseum. +3 Happiness, +1 Culture

uniques.name: Seaxman
uniques.value: Replaces Longswordsman. Available at Chivalry. 22 Strength, Cover I, Amphibious.

uniques.name: Oppidum of Bribacte
uniques.value: Start with a Murus Gallicus

uniques.name: Noble Swordsmen
uniques.value: Replaced the Longswordsman. 20 strength, +33% combat bonus when attacking and +50% combat strength in forests, does not require Iron

uniques.name: Murus Gallicus
uniques.value: Replaces the Wall. Slightly cheaper (44 hammers vs 50) and better (+6 defence vs 5). +1 Production and +1 Happiness, with an additional Production at Metal Casting.

uniques.name: Furor Teutonicus
uniques.value: +1 Science and Production from Workshops, Windmills, Factories and Hydro Plants. 33% extra engineer generation

uniques.name: Hanse
uniques.value: Unique building of the German civilization. Requires Market. Replaces the Bank.

uniques.name: Panzer
uniques.value: Unique armored unit of the German civilization. Replaces the Tank. Requires Oil.

uniques.name: Golden Conquest
uniques.value: Receive a free Great Artist upon completing a Jarliq in a city.

uniques.name: Ulan
uniques.value: Replaces Pikeman. Mounted unit, 16 strength, 4 movement, Ambush Formation I, no penalty against cities. Requires Horses

uniques.name: Jarliq
uniques.value: Replaces Courthouse. Requires Writing. Additionally provides +3 gold and +3 science. No maintenance cost.

uniques.name: Drauhtinon
uniques.value: Melee and gunpowder have +1 Movement. 33% combat bonus against barbarians. Upon defeating a barbarian inside a camp, earn 25 Gold and they join your side.

uniques.name: Gadrauht
uniques.value: Replaces Longswordsman. 22 Strength, slightly cheaper. Moves along enemy roads as if they were friendly. Doesn’t require iron.

uniques.name: Harjis
uniques.value: Available at Mining. Must be adjacent to a luxury resource and cannot be next to another Harji or on resources. Provides +1 Production. Provides +1 Production upon the discovery of Iron Working, Gunpowder and Dynamite.

uniques.name: Hellenic League
uniques.value: City-State Influence degrades at half and recovers at twice the normal rate.

uniques.name: Odeon
uniques.value: +4 Culture, +1 Gold and +1 Writer slot (replaces Amphitheater).

uniques.name: Hoplite
uniques.value: A Greek unique front-line unit. Replaces the Spearman.

uniques.name: Bronze and Iron
uniques.value: +1 Gold from Mines. Starts with Mining.

uniques.name: Lion’s Gate
uniques.value: Replaces Walls. +2 Gold and +2 Culture.

uniques.name: Heavy Chariot
uniques.value: Replaces Chariot Archer. 3 Movement, 10 Ranged Strength, 10 Melee (can’t melee attack). +20% strength while defending. Requires Horses

uniques.name: Scourge of God
uniques.value: Raze Cities at double speed. Borrow City names from other in-game Civs. Start with Animal Husbandry technology. +1 Production per Pasture.

uniques.name: Qara U’y
uniques.value: Replaces Stable. +1 faith from Horses, provides +2 Horses (like Recycling Center)

uniques.name: Horse Archer
uniques.value: Unique Hunnic early ranged mounted unit. Replaces the Chariot Archer. Requires Horses

uniques.name: Verszerzodes
uniques.value: +1 Production and Culture from Defensive Buildings.

uniques.name: Black Arquebusier
uniques.value: Replaces Musketman. 24 Melee and Ranged Strength, can both melee and ranged attack, must set up to ranged attack. Starts with Accuracy 1.

uniques.name: Orszaggyules
uniques.value: Replaces Palace. In addition to the regular effects of the palace, a second one may be constructed to move the capital, and the original can be sold and moved as well. The capital is located in the last city to build an Orszaggyules. Provides +25% Great Person generation, +10% production towards buildings, and +3 Culture, Food and Production at Chivalry. Requires Mathematics to be constructed.

uniques.name: Great Andean Road
uniques.value: Units ignore terrain costs when moving into any tile with Hills. No maintenance costs for improvements in Hills; half cost elsewhere.

uniques.name: Terrace Farm
uniques.value: Unique improvement of the Incan civilization. Requires Construction.

uniques.name: Slinger
uniques.value: Unique ranged unit of the Incan civilization. Replaces the Archer. 5 Melee Strength (up from 4).

uniques.name: Population Growth
uniques.value: Unhappiness from number of Cities doubled, Unhappiness from number of Citizens halved.

uniques.name: Mughal Fort
uniques.value: Unique building of the Indian civilization. Requires Walls. Replaces the Castle. +4 Culture, +2 Happiness, +2 Tourism at Flight

uniques.name: War Elephant
uniques.value: Unique ranged mounted unit of the Indian civilization. Replaces the Chariot Archer. +50% strength against melee units.

uniques.name: Spice Islanders
uniques.value: The first 3 costal cities each provide 2 unique Luxury Resources (and can never be razed).

uniques.name: Candi
uniques.value: Unique building of the Indonesian civilization. Replaces the Garden. May be built in all cities.

uniques.name: Kris Swordsman
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Indonesian civilization. Replaces the Swordsman. Requires Iron. 15 Combat Strength (up from 14) and bad outcomes removed.

uniques.name: The Great Warpath
uniques.value: Units move through Forest and Jungle in friendly territory as if they were Roads. These tiles can be used to establish 20xCityConnection5 City Connections upon researching The Wheel. Caravans move along Forest and Jungle as if they were Roads.

uniques.name: Longhouse
uniques.value: +10% production (like regular Workshop), also provides +1 Production from Jungle tiles, costs the same and available at Iron Working.

uniques.name: Mohawk Warrior
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the Iroquois civilization. Replaces the Swordsman. Has 15 Combat Strength (up from 14)

uniques.name: The Promised Land
uniques.value: +1 Culture from Pastures

uniques.name: Maccabee
uniques.value: Replaces Swordsman. Much cheaper. On kill, 100% of the enemy units strength is added as faith.

uniques.name: Yeshiva
uniques.value: Replaces the Temple. More expensive (80 hammers vs 67), but provides +1 food and production.

uniques.name: Rinascimento
uniques.value: +1 Culture from Specialists. +1 Happiness per 4 Policies.

uniques.name: Pittore
uniques.value: Replaces Great Artist. Golden Ages started by them are 9 turns instead of 6 (on quick speed). Scales to 14 turns with Chichen Itza/Freedom 3, 19 with both.

uniques.name: Basilica
uniques.value: Replaces Museum. Available at Industrialization, +20% Great Person Rate, 2 Artist Specialist slots, +2 Great Artist points per turn.

uniques.name: Bushido
uniques.value: Units fight as though they were at full strength even when damaged. +1 Culture from each Fishing Boat and +2 Culture from Atolls.

uniques.name: Dojo
uniques.value: Replaces Barracks. +2 science. +10% combat strength for land units built in this city.

uniques.name: Samurai
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Japanese civilization. Replaces the Longswordsman. Requires Iron.

uniques.name: The Holy Land
uniques.value: +1 Faith from Luxury Resources.

uniques.name: Crusader
uniques.value: Replaces Longswordsman. 17 Strength, slightly cheaper to produce. Available at Theology. Receives Faith from kills and has 20% combat bonus outside friendly territory.

uniques.name: Outremer
uniques.value: Replaces Courthouse. +2 Culture, +2 Happiness, +2 Faith.

uniques.name: Heart of Africa
uniques.value: Borders grow 33% faster.

uniques.name: Ngao Mbeba
uniques.value: Replaces Swordsman. 15 strength, 100% cover bonus. Cannot attack.

uniques.name: Slave Market
uniques.value: Replaces Colosseum. Costs 80 production, subtracts 1 population from every city. Provides +5 production and +8 gold, with an additional +5 production at Industrialization. Does not provide any happiness.

uniques.name: Grand Baray of Angkor
uniques.value: Receive a free Baray in the capital.

uniques.name: Ballista Elephant
uniques.value: Replaces Crossbowman, 17 ranged and melee strength, 2 moves 2 range, ranged unit, Feared Elephant promo

uniques.name: Baray
uniques.value: Replaces Garden. In addition to usual effects: 10% of food is carried over after a new citizen is born, +2 faith +2 food at Drama and Poetry

uniques.name: Scholars of the Jade Hall
uniques.value: +1 Science from Specialists, +1 Science from the Palace

uniques.name: H’wacha
uniques.value: Unique ranged unit of the Korean civilization. Replaces the Trebuchet.

uniques.name: Turtle Ship
uniques.value: Unique naval unit of the Korean civilization. Replaces the Caravel.

uniques.name: Baltic Mythology
uniques.value: Prophets are turned into Krivis, which cannot found a religion but can construct Sacred Groves. Can’t found a religion.

uniques.name: Pestininkas
uniques.value: Replaces Pikeman, cheaper to train (40 hammers vs 60)

uniques.name: Sacred Grove
uniques.value: Provides +1 Food, Production, Culture, Science and Faith base, and an additional of each at Philosophy, Theology, Acoustics, Archaeology

uniques.name: Vilnius Temple
uniques.value: Behaves like a Grand Temple but you can build it without having a religion.

uniques.name: Macedonian Discipline
uniques.value: Barracks and Armories provide +1 Food and +1 Happiness. All Land units receive the Quick Study promotion. Receive a free Hetairoi at Horseback Riding.

uniques.name: Hetairoi
uniques.value: Replaces Great General. 15 Combat Strength, requires 1 Horse, 5 Movement, General bonus provided to units with 2 Tiles. Receives Great Generals II, March, Charge and Heavy Charge promotions for free. Can upgrade to knight, but loses ability to make citadels

uniques.name: Sarissophoroi
uniques.value: Replaces Pikeman. Available at Philosophy instead of Civil Service. +100% combat strength against mounted units. 14 Strength.

uniques.name: Sacred Hills of Imerina
uniques.value: +6 Culture and Faith from Holy Sites.

uniques.name: Mpiambina
uniques.value: Replaces Inquisitor (after buying a Inquisitor). 1 Range Ranged Unit, 8 Strength melee and 14 Ranged. Receives 1 unique promotion after first combat.

uniques.name: Rova
uniques.value: Replaces Walls. Provides an additional +1 Happiness and +3 Faith.

uniques.name: Eight Banners
uniques.value: All Manchu mounted units receive the Volley promotion (+50% combat strength against fortified units and cities) and cost no maintenance.

uniques.name: Canton Factory
uniques.value: Replaces Bank. +35% Gold, +2 Gold, 2 Merchant Specialists, Cheaper to construct (67 vs 100 hammers).

uniques.name: Qianlong Cavalry
uniques.value: Replaces Cavalry. 34 Strength, 5 Movement, Great Generals

uniques.name: The Long Count
uniques.value: After researching Theology, receive a bonus Great Person at the end of every Maya Long Count calendar cycle (every 394 years). Each bonus person can only be chosen once.

uniques.name: Pyramid
uniques.value: Unique building of the Mayan civilization. Replaces the Shrine.

uniques.name: Atlatlist
uniques.value: Unique ranged unit of the Mayan civilization, available from the start of the game. Replaces the Archer.

uniques.name: Encomienda System
uniques.value: Receives a free Worker at Pottery. City-States that are afraid of Mexico gain 10 Influence per turn when Mexico can tribute them but does not.

uniques.name: Ranchero
uniques.value: Replaces Settler. Does not stop growth to produce.

uniques.name: Hacienda
uniques.value: Replaces Windmill. Provides +1 Production on Luxuries, +1 Gold on Bonus Resources, and +1 Food on Strategic Resources.

uniques.name: Mongol Terror
uniques.value: Combat Strength +30% when fighting City-State units or attacking a City-State itself. All mounted and armored units have +1 Movement

uniques.name: Khan
uniques.value: A Great Person, unique to the Mongolian civilization. Replaces the Great General.

uniques.name: Keshik
uniques.value: The Mongolian unique ranged mounted unit. Replaces the Knight. Requires Horses. 18 Combat and Ranged Strength, 1 range (down from 2).

uniques.name: Gateway To Africa
uniques.value: Each trading partner will grant an additional +1 Gold / +1 Culture per era (3/1 ancient, 4/2 classical, 5/3 medieval, etc, per partner).

uniques.name: Kasbah
uniques.value: Unique improvement of the Moroccan civilization. Requires Chivalry. +2 food, +1 production, +1 gold

uniques.name: Berber Cavalry
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Moroccan civilization. Replaces the Cavalry. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Dutch East India Company
uniques.value: +1 Happiness per unique Luxury in the Empire and +1 Gold from Luxury resource tiles.

uniques.name: Polder
uniques.value: Unique improvement of the Dutch civilization. Requires Guilds.

uniques.name: Sea Beggar
uniques.value: Coastal Raiders 1 Promotion, Boarding Party 1, Supply Promotion and the Prize Ships Promotion (in total)

uniques.name: Castle Builders
uniques.value: +10% combat strength outside of friendly territory. All cities receive +5 Defense.

uniques.name: Motte and Bailey
uniques.value: Available at Engineering. +1 Food, +1 Production. +2 Culture at Flight. Cannot be built adjacent to each other. Must be next to a luxury resource. +25% Combat Strength on this tile.

uniques.name: Pedite
uniques.value: Replaces Swordsman. 15 Strength, Shock I, can construct Motte and Baileys.

uniques.name: Nordic Bounty
uniques.value: +1 Food and +1 Production from Snow. +1 Production from Tundra.

uniques.name: Ski Infantry
uniques.value: Replaces Great War Infantry. 50 Strength, Drill I, II, and Ski Infantry Promotion.

uniques.name: Stave Church
uniques.value: Replaces Temple. Decreased cost (50 hammers vs 67), requires no maintenance. +1 Faith from Coastal Resources.

uniques.name: Ta-Seti
uniques.value: +20% Production towards ranged and recon units, +1 Food from Floodplains

uniques.name: Apedemak’s Bow
uniques.value: Replaces Scout, 5 Ranged and 5 Melee Strength, has 3 Range, is considered a Recon Unit, costs same as a Warrior.

uniques.name: Blast Furnace
uniques.value: Replaces Forge, can be built anywhere, cheaper, additionally provides +2 culture from Iron and gives Accuracy 1 to ranged, siege and recon units.

uniques.name: Millets
uniques.value: Each city gets +1 Happiness for each Religion in that city, +33 religious bonus in the capital.

uniques.name: Sipahi
uniques.value: Unique mounted unit of the Ottoman Empire. Replaces the Lancer. Requires Horses. Available at Gunpowder and costs 20% less Production to train.

uniques.name: Janissary
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the Ottoman Empire. Replaces the Musketman. Costs 20% less Production to train.

uniques.name: The Holy See
uniques.value: +1 of every yield from Holy Sites. Receives 2 free delegates.

uniques.name: Swiss Guard
uniques.value: Replaces Landsknecht. Does not require the Mercenary Army policy, but still must be purchased. Receives Faith and Gold from kills, extra Gold from pillaging and has Medic I and II promotions.

uniques.name: St. Peter’s Basilica
uniques.value: Replaces Grand Temple - Additionally provides a free Cathedral and Great Prophet.

uniques.name: Achaemenid Legacy
uniques.value: Golden Ages last 50% longer. During a Golden Age, units receive +1 Movement and a +10% Combat Strength bonus.

uniques.name: Immortal
uniques.value: The Persian unique front-line unit. Replaces the Spearman.

uniques.name: Satrap's Court
uniques.value: Unique building of the Persian civilization. Requires Market. Replaces the Bank.

uniques.name: Skillful Traders
uniques.value: Sea Trade routes have an 50% increase in range. Start with a Square Sail Ship.

uniques.name: Square Sail Ship
uniques.value: Replaces the Trireme. Can enter deep ocean and is slightly cheaper (25 hammers vs 30).

uniques.name: Trade Harbour
uniques.value: Replaces the Harbor. In addition it provides +15% Production towards Naval Units and +1 Production to Sea Resources.

uniques.name: Solidarity
uniques.value: 10% cheaper Social Policies.

uniques.name: Ducal Stable
uniques.value: Unique building of the Polish civilization. Replaces the Stable.

uniques.name: Winged Hussar
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Polish civilization. Replaces the Lancer. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Wayfinding
uniques.value: All embarked units also have +1 Movement and extra defense

uniques.name: Moai
uniques.value: Unique improvement of the Polynesian civilization. Requires Construction.

uniques.name: Maori Warrior
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Polynesian civilization. Replaces the Warrior. Available from the start of the game.

uniques.name: Mare Clausum
uniques.value: Resource diversity grants twice as much Gold for Portugal in Trade Routes. 25% reduction cost for Caravans and Cargo Ships.

uniques.name: Feitoria
uniques.value: Replaces Harbor. +1 Gold from Coastal Resources, +15% Production for Naval Units. Slightly cheaper to build and doesn’t cost maintenance.

uniques.name: Nau
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Portuguese civilization. Replaces the Caravel.

uniques.name: Army with a State
uniques.value: All Prussian trained land units may receive unique Prussian Promotions upon leveling up. Paradropping units can’t pick the extra attack promotion. +50% production and food from internal trade routes.

uniques.name: Totenkopf Hussar
uniques.value: Replaces Cavalry. 34 Strength, 5 Movement, Heals 25 HP upon killing an enemy unit.

uniques.name: Landwehr
uniques.value: Replaces Rifleman. 34 Strength, available at Military Science, starts with Blitz and Quick Study. Has unique promotions.

uniques.name: Nihil Sine Deo
uniques.value: +1 Culture from Shrines and Temples.

uniques.name: Vanator
uniques.value: Replaces Gatling Gun. Has 31 Strength and 2 range.

uniques.name: Painted Monastery
uniques.value: Has a Great Work of Art slot, +2 Faith. Doesn't have to built on freshwater. Replaces Garden.

uniques.name: The Glory of Rome
uniques.value: +25% Production towards any buildings that already exist in the Capital.

uniques.name: Ballista
uniques.value: Unique siege unit of the Roman civilization. Replaces the Catapult. Has Indirect Fire.

uniques.name: Legion
uniques.value: Unique front-line unit of the Roman civilization. Replaces the Swordsman. Requires Iron.

uniques.name: Siberian Riches
uniques.value: Strategic Resources provide +1 Production, and Horse, Iron and Uranium Resources provide double quantity.

uniques.name: Krepost
uniques.value: Unique building of the Russian civilization. Replaces the Barracks.

uniques.name: Cossack
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Russian civilization. Replaces the Cavalry. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Great Expanse
uniques.value: Founded cities start with 4 additional tiles (from 8). Units receive a 15% combat bonus when fighting within their own territory.

uniques.name: Pathfinder
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Shoshone civilization. Replaces the Scout. Available right from the start of the game.

uniques.name: Comanche Riders
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Shoshone civilization. Replaces Cavalry. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Father Governs Children
uniques.value: Food, Culture and Faith from friendly City-States increased by 50%.

uniques.name: Wat
uniques.value: Unique building of the Siamese civilization. Requires Library. Replaces the University.

uniques.name: Naresuan’s Elephant
uniques.value: Unique mounted unit of the Siamese civilization. Replaces the Knight.

uniques.name: Dwellers of the Plains
uniques.value: +15% Combat Strength in Plains.

uniques.name: Buffalo Hunter
uniques.value: Replaces Composite Bowman. 8 Melee Strength, 13 Ranged Strength. Can construct Tipis.

uniques.name: Tipi
uniques.value: Can only be constructed on flat plains or flatland deer/bison. Must be adjacent to luxuries. Provides +1 Food, +1 Faith. Bonus +1 Culture if adjacent to a city, +1 Gold if adjacent to a river. Provides +1 Food at Civil Service and +1 Faith at Theology. Requires Trapping.

uniques.name: River Warlord
uniques.value: Receive triple Gold from Barbarian encampments and pillaging Cities. Land units gain the Amphibious promotion, strengthening them while embarked. Units ignore terrain costs while moving along or across rivers.

uniques.name: Mud Pyramid Mosque
uniques.value: Unique building of the Songhai civilization. Requires Shrine. Replaces the Temple.

uniques.name: Mandekalu Cavalry
uniques.value: The Songhai civilization's unique mounted unit. Replaces the Knight. Requires Horses.

uniques.name: Seven Cities of Gold
uniques.value: Grants 100 gold per Natural Wonder discovered (down from 500 gold for first finder and 100 gold otherwise).

uniques.name: Plaza de Toros
uniques.value: Replaces Circus. +2 Culture, may also be built with an improved source of Cows.

uniques.name: Tercio
uniques.value: Unique Renaissance Era unit of the Spanish civilization. Replaces the Musketman.

uniques.name: Cradle of Civilization
uniques.value: +2 Culture from every city upon the discovery of Drama and Poetry.

uniques.name: Ziggurat
uniques.value: Replaces Temple. +2 Faith, +5% Science.

uniques.name: Phalanx
uniques.value: Replaces Spearman. Available at Mining. 11 Strength, +50% Flanking bonus, slightly cheaper to produce.

uniques.name: Nobel Prize
uniques.value: +20% Great Person points in all cities.

uniques.name: Carolean
uniques.value: Replaces Musketman. 24 Strength, free March promotion

uniques.name: Falu Gruva
uniques.value: Replaces Ironworks. +1 Production from hills in this city. 6 Tourism at Flight

uniques.name: Eightfold Path to Nirvana
uniques.value: Cannot train Settler or Conquistadors. All cities receive a free Stupa that provides +1 Culture, Science, Production, Gold and Faith.

uniques.name: Dalai Lama
uniques.value: Replaces Great Prophet. No vision penalty and can spread religion 1 extra time.

uniques.name: Monastery
uniques.value: Can only be built on hills. Provides +2 Faith, +1 additional Faith at Theology. +1 Culture for each adjacent mountain. Can be built on forest and jungle without removing them.

uniques.name: Ulugh Beg’s Observatory
uniques.value: +5 Combat Strength, +10% Science, Production, Gold and Culture in the original capital. These bonuses are terminated if the original capital is lost.

uniques.name: Marathi Rider
uniques.value: Medieval Air unit, available at Chivalry. Replaces Horsemen. Requires 1 horse, has 4 range, and 21 combat strength. Uses air mechanics and promotions.

uniques.name: Serai
uniques.value: Replaces Caravansary. +1 gold per 3 pop, allows units to airlift between cities with Serais and increases air unit capacity by 1.

uniques.name: Principalities of the Rus
uniques.value: +20% Gold per turn from City Connections. +1 Gold from Specialists.

uniques.name: Tachanka
uniques.value: Replaces Gatling Gun. 30 Melee Strength, 30 Ranged Strength, 2 Range, 4 Moves. Requires Horses, is considered a Mounted Ranged unit. Loses all movement upon entering rough terrain.

uniques.name: Knyaz Court
uniques.value: Replaces Market. +2 Gold, +25% gold, Receive 20 Gold per Knyaz Court when a Great Person is consumed.

uniques.name: Serenissima
uniques.value: Can train regular settlers. Sea trade routes cannot be plundered. Receives a Great Merchant upon the discovery of Compass. Cannot train Conquistadors.

uniques.name: Merchant of Venice
uniques.value: A unique Great Person of the Venetian civilization, specialized in Trading. Replaces the Great Merchant.

uniques.name: Grand Canal
uniques.value: Replaces East India Company. Provides +2 Trade Routes, +25% Gold and +4 Gold. Provides increased gold from trade routes.

uniques.name: Tam Giao
uniques.value: +2 Food, +1 Production from Marsh. +1 Faith from Jungle.

uniques.name: Viet Cong
uniques.value: Replaces Infantry. 70 Strength, is Invisible except to adjacent units and can traverse mountains, taking regular damage if they end turn on them.

uniques.name: Vo Khi
uniques.value: Replaces Armory. Available at Metal Casting, +1 Food, +1 Culture and +1 Production from Marsh. +1 Culture from Jungle. All melee units trained in a city with a Vo Khi receive the Woodsman promotion. Doesn’t require Barracks.

uniques.name: Iklwa
uniques.value: Melee units cost 50% less maintenance. All units require 25% less experience to earn their next promotion

uniques.name: Ikanda
uniques.value: Unique building of the Zulu civilization. Replaces the Barracks.

uniques.name: Impi
uniques.value: Unique unit of the Zulu civilization. Replaces the Pikeman.
